intro: Opithandra, commonly known as the silky oaks, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their large, leathery leaves and showy, fluffy inflorescences. Opithandra species typically grow as trees or shrubs, with some species reaching heights of up to 30 meters. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are borne in dense, spherical clusters. These plants are adapted to a variety of soil types and are often found in woodland and forest habitats.
